history.narrative: Law 8-7 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-223. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 21, 1989 and April 4, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 17, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-23 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: kwiktag 103 201 149 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 8-7 "Commission on Mental Health Services Employees Retention Temporary Amendment Act of 1989 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 8-223 on first and second readings, March 21, 1989, and April 4, 1989, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on April 17, 1989, this legislation was assigned Act No. 8-23, published in the April 28, 1989, edition of the D.C Register Vol. 36 page 2844) and transmitted to Congress on April 19, 1989 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 8-7, effective June 8, 1989 DAVID A. CLARKE Chairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congression~l Review Pe~i d: April 19,25,26,27,28 May 1,2,3,4,5,8,9,10,11,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,31 June 1,2,5,6,7 LAW 8 JUN 0 8 1989 AN ACT D.C. 8 £ 8 Enz’olle(t O~:l.8:tnal CODTFICA~TO District of Columbia Code (1989 Supp IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA APR 7 1989 To amend, on a temporary basis, the Saint Elizabeths Hospital and District of Columbia Mental Health Services Act to allow individuals who were employed at Saint Elizabeths Hospital before October I, 1987, accepted employment with the Commission on Mental Health Services on October I, 1987, and have been employed by the District of Columbia government since that time without a break in service, to continue their employment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Commission on Mental Health Services Employees Retention Temporary Amendment Act of 1989 Sec. 2. Section 7(a)(2) of the Saint Elizabeths Hospital and District of Columbia Mental Health Services Act, approved November 8, 1984 (98 Stat. 3369; D.C. Code, sec. 32-626(a)(2 is amended to read as follows 2) Meet all licensure requirements by the expiration date of the Commission on Mental Health Services Employees Retention Temporary Amendment Act of 1989, except that, each individual who continues employment pursuant to this paragraph shall notify, within 30 days of the effective date of this act, the board or commission that has jurisdiction over the profession or occupation practiced by the individual that he or she is practicing the occupation or profession pursuant to this paragraph and the individual shall be subject to the disciplinary authority of the appropriate board or commission in its place. Sec. 3 a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Note, sec. 32-626 ¯ n~olle~ OPiglnsl Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code, sec. 1-233(c)(I and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations b) This act shall expire on the 225th day of its having taken effect.
